article.headline: Twitter makes moves to stop spread of election misinformation
article.body: Twitter Inc. TWTR, -0.23% says it is taking steps to stop the spread of election misinformation -- the latest social-media platform to do so. The company's push is to protect "critical dialogue" on Twitter "from attempts - both foreign and domestic - to undermine it," Twitter General Counsel Vijaya Gadde and Kayvon Beykpour, head of product, said in a blog post. Twitter is rolling out the changes in phases beginning next week. On Wednesday, Facebook Inc. FB, +0.26% said it would stop political ads in the U.S. for at least a week after polls close Nov. 3.
